explains: adj. 牙买加的；牙买加人的

sentences.en: Jamaican reggae music is quite distinct from North American jazz or blues.
sentences.cn: 牙买加的雷盖音乐完全不同于北美的爵士乐或布鲁斯音乐。

sentences.en: The 32-year-old Jamaican-born fighter believes he can still regain some of his old magic.
sentences.cn: 那个32岁、生于牙买加的斗士相信自己仍能重拾一些昔日的神奇功能。

sentences.en: When Nijay Williams entered college last fall as a first-generation student and Jamaican immigrant, he was academically unprepared for the rigors of higher education.
sentences.cn: 去年秋天，当 Nijay Williams 作为第一代学生和一名牙买加移民进入大学时，他还没有做好接受高等教育的学业方面的准备。
